TopicTitle: BSC: Albatross 3 - And the winner is...

Articles.Content: sirine having twice the votes of mcirish? i call shenanigans.

so a question for you master plane builders, how do you get long wings to stay stiff? i can build ssto's pretty quickly and easily but they as a rule can't have more than 2-3 rectangular structural wings because of mega flex issues, and struts dont' seem to help me much

Yeah, it's tricky. You can't use struts that are flat-packed close to the wing. You need a tall fuselage (like the mk3s) or a vertical "spine" fin to fasten the wing struts to, so they form a nice tall triangle. That can handle a lot of stress before snapping.

If you put struts that are almost parallel to the wing, the tension / compression stresses in the strut get too high and the wing will detach. Kind of like if you bend corrugated cardboard.

Yeah, it's tricky. You can't use struts that are flat-packed close to the wing. You need a tall fuselage (like the mk3s) or a vertical "spine" fin to fasten the wing struts to, so they form a nice tall triangle. That can handle a lot of stress before snapping.

If you put struts that are almost parallel to the wing, the tension / compression stresses in the strut get too high and the wing will detach. Kind of like if you bend corrugated cardboard.

Hilarious that Kerbals have successfully constructed more complex rocketry than NASA but have not figured out properly cantilevered wings and need to rely on Wright Flyer level strutted wings
While I, too wonder who all these anonymous voters for sirine are - please refrain from any accusations and keep calm. It's just a challenge for a pc-game.
you know you can set the vote to public veiw...

Oh my... My plane get to the finals... I could never expect... Well, although I like my plane:D I must admit that I'll not be voting on it this time. Now I need to discover which of them is more "Stock"...

EDIT: And what is next??? Hypersonic jets, SSTOs, cargo planes, rockets...

Well Xeldrak, I don't know. I would be mad as heck about the results of this build off, when both second and third place are in violation of the rules. Usually when you treat people as adults they act like adults. That is how it usually is, however, in this case it would seem that nearly 50% of the voters are ignoring the rules. Not sure what methods you have for enforcement but might be time to tighten up the rules on the next challenge. They may call you a jerk but you can just point to this challenge and say, "sorry, you're the idiots who who spoiled it for everyone else".

The Albatross

While I can appreciate the design aesthetic I'm not a fan of the stepped wings and upside down fuselages. Also has reaction wheels which I don't think any low altidute plane should need

While I don't feel that an albatross replacement needs perfect controls they should be consistent and in this entry they are rather unpredictable. so I could not even get it to point in the direction I intended to travel.

The Nose up tendency becomes very pronounced as fuel drains and it is uncontrollable in an empty glide.

Ahlbetossed IVb

Looks the part, but turbojets and vtol does not really fit the albatross. Also has reaction wheels.

Tail strike hazard on (horizontal) take off, lost the central engine. Flies fairly well

Albatross 18

Looks good but not very albatrossy. reaction wheels

Tail strike can take out half the plane. Flies well but does not have much ability to pitch up when gliding making it tricky to land.

fuel does not drain from side tanks. not particularly long range

Diamond Flyer

Looks good, but more a ravenspear than an albatross. No description. Reaction wheels and stacked intakes.

Flies well.

Ensoku

Like this, no reaction wheels and circular intakes. looks quite albatrossy. Clever rudder placement.

Flies and glides very well when full of fuel.

CoM will shift behind CoL when it empties, though fuel ducting does delay this until last tanks. While SAS can mostly handle it, there is a noticable nose up when maneuvering which can make precision landing difficult.

Condor

And here I thought I was going big when I built the Pelican, Love it. Could have used an action group for the ladder.

Fuel ducting is a problem here, some symmetrically placed parts were probably repositioned after fuel lines were placed and the fuel lines failed to connect properly, making the fuel flow slightly asymmetric. Lots of control surfaces give it a slight infiniglide effect especially when empty

All in all after a more detailed test of the finalists, I should probably change my vote to the Ensoku. However I will stick with the Condor since I dont feel it is getting the love it deserves as the only suitable albatross replacement other than the Ensoku to make it to the finals.

Well, it looks like there are several people that agree with my point of view. Therefore, Sirine shall have his third place (well, poll closes in ~3 hours) and be happy with a award he got by telling friends to vote for him. Seriously, I don't have the nerve for any more bickering - my hope was, that if I treat everyone mature, they would behave mature. But it seems like it still have to do something to enforce the rules...

When this challenge is done, I'll add a Unsportsmanlike conduct clause to the rules, allowing me to ban people from this compedition of hand out penalties as I see fit. Please note, Sirine, that if I were a "immature guy that do not forget and forgive", I would implement these rules NOW. But you shall have your award - to be honest, I'd pin it to your signature if I could. Also the final votes will be public from now on.
